block.p: BETSY KING CLASSIC Richard and Daniel Share the Lead
Deb Richard and Beth Daniel shot five-under-par 67's yesterday in Kutztown, Pa., to share the opening-round lead in the LPGA First Union Betsy King Classic at Berkleigh Country Club.
Richard and Daniel each had six birdies and one bogey, including two-under 33's on the front nine.
Thirty-nine players in the field of 140 golfers broke par.
TEXAS OPEN Weibring Holds One-Stroke Lead
D.A. Weibring wasn't sure earlier this week whether he would be playing in the Texas Open or traveling to Illinois to tend to his sick mother.
With his family's support, he opted to play golf. He wasn't disappointed. Weibring shot a seven-under-par 65 yesterday in San Antonio to take a one-stroke lead in the first round of the Texas Open.

Weibring felt confident his mother, recuperating well after colon surgery, would cheer his first-round performance. He reeled off seven birdies and enjoyed a bogey-free day for his best start since shooting a 64 in the Quad City Classic in July.
Jim McGovern shot a six-under 66, overcoming two bogeys with the help of six birdies plus a 10-foot putt for eagle on the par-5 14th hole. (AP)
GERMAN MASTERS Montgomerie, Singh Are Tied With 65's
Colin Montgomerie, seeking to become Europe's leading money winner for a sixth straight year, shot a seven-under-par 65 yesterday to share the first- round lead at the German Masters at Cologne.
The Scotsman had seven birdies and no bogeys on a sunny windless day.(AP)
